The email on choosing the right classes to test was very helpful.  Writing
tests to illustrate reported bugs sounds like an excellent approach.  I am
working on a decent sized system that does not have any tests so choosing
test areas was a question of mine as well.
	I have a second problem with testing this system.  How do you test a
tightly coupled system?  One answer is to use tests to drive better design.
However, it would take too long and be too risky to redesign major parts of
the system.  So, while the design takes time to improve, do you have any
suggestions for how to test a very coupled system that requires setting up
several things before the class being tested will function properly?  i.e.
What are some good strategies that will help locate bugs and improve
development speed without shutting down development?
subject: unit testing a tightly coupled system
